intro: Isotropis biloba, commonly known as the two-leaved isotropis, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has a compact, bushy structure. Its leaves are divided into two distinct lobes, giving it the species name "biloba." The small, yellowish flowers appear in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family, and are followed by small, dry fruits.
